intro: Geigeria mendoncae, commonly known as the Mexican germander, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, aromatic leaves. It is often found in open woodlands and grasslands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
